documentation.text:
Remove the specified role from the contract calling this function.
 This is for cleanup only, so if another contract has taken the
 role, this does nothing.
 @param _interfaceIdentifierHash The interface identifier to remove from
                                 the registry.

Enact the code of one of the governance contracts.
 @param _delegate The contract code to delegate execution to.

Initialize the contract (replaces constructor)
 Policy contracts are often the targets of proxies, and therefore need a
 mechanism to initialize internal state when adopted by a new proxy. This
 replaces the constructor.
 @param _self The address of the original contract deployment (as opposed
              to the address of the proxy contract, which takes the place
              of `this`).

documentation.text:
Remove the specified role from the contract calling this function.
 This is for cleanup only, so if another contract has taken the
 role, this does nothing.
 @param _interfaceIdentifierHash The interface identifier to remove from
                                 the registry.

Enact the code of one of the governance contracts.
 @param _delegate The contract code to delegate execution to.

Initialize the contract (replaces constructor)
 Policy contracts are often the targets of proxies, and therefore need a
 mechanism to initialize internal state when adopted by a new proxy. This
 replaces the constructor.
 @param _self The address of the original contract deployment (as opposed
              to the address of the proxy contract, which takes the place
              of `this`).

params._self: The address of the original contract deployment (as opposed              to the address of the proxy contract, which takes the place              of `this`).

params._delegate: The contract code to delegate execution to.

params._interfaceIdentifierHash: The hash of the interface identifier                                 look up.
The interface identifier to remove from                                 the registry.

params._implementer: The contract to assume the label.
params._key: The label to apply to the contract.

devdoc.title: The policy contract that oversees other contracts Policy contracts provide a mechanism for building pluggable (after deploy) governance systems for other contracts.

implementation().notice: Get the address of the proxy target contract.

initialize(address).notice: Initialize the contract (replaces constructor) Policy contracts are often the targets of proxies, and therefore need a mechanism to initialize internal state when adopted by a new proxy. This replaces the constructor.

internalCommand(address).notice: Enact the code of one of the governance contracts.

policyFor(bytes32).notice: Find the policy contract for a particular identifier.

removeSelf(bytes32).notice: Remove the specified role from the contract calling this function. This is for cleanup only, so if another contract has taken the role, this does nothing.

setPolicy(bytes32,address).notice: Set the policy label for a contract
